title: How to Fix Xbox 360 Disc Drive Problems

parts.name: Solve a reading... open tray problem

steps.headline: Clean the disk with a slightly damp cloth.
Remove stickers.
If this doesn't work, follow the instructions below.
Turn off the console, and remove any USB drives attached.
Check that the game is the correct region code.
steps.description:
NTSC: North America and South America (United States, Canada, Mexico, Chile, and Brazil)
NTSC-J: Asia (Hong Kong SAR, Japan, Korea, Singapore, and Taiwan)
PAL: Europe, South Africa, India, Australia, and New Zealand

steps.headline: Try another game.
If all of the above fails, your console will need service.
Check the DVD region.
steps.description:
1: United States, Canada, Bermuda, U.S. territories
2: Europe (except Russia, Ukraine and Belarus), Middle East, Egypt, Japan, South Africa, Swaziland, Lesotho, Greenland
3: Southeast Asia, South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong SAR, Macau
4: Mexico, Central and South America, Australia, New Zealand, Oceania
5: India, Afghanistan, Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, Africa, Central and South Asia, North Korea
6: People's Republic of China, Hong Kong
7: Reserved
8: Special international venues, such as airplanes and cruise ships

steps.headline: Try another DVD.
If all of the above fails, your console will need service.
Check the CD format.
steps.description: The following CD formats are supported by Xbox: CD-DA, CD-ROM, CD-ROM XA, CD-R, CD-RW, CD-Extra. The following music files are supported: WMA, MP3, JPEG.

steps.headline: Try another CD.
If all of the above fails, your console will need service.

parts.name: Correct disc tray stuck open error

steps.headline: Check the power button.
steps.description: If the Xbox is on, move on to the next step. If it is not on, check the power source and cables.

steps.headline: Remove the disc from the tray, then press eject.
steps.description: If the tray closes, open the tray and insert the disc. Try to use the tray with a disc in it.

steps.headline: Gently move the disc tray up and down, left and right.
steps.description: Then press eject. If it closes, try to use the tray with a disc in it.

steps.headline: If all of the above fails, your console will need service.

parts.name: Correct  disc tray stuck shut error

steps.headline: Check the power button.
steps.description: If the Xbox is on, move on to the next step. If it is not on, check the power source and cables.

steps.headline: Check for a plastic strip.
steps.description: This is used to keep the disc tray shut while the Xbox is shipped. If you find one, peel it off.

steps.headline: Try to manually open the disk drive.
steps.description: You can find how to do this for your console online.

steps.headline: If all of the above fails, your console will need service.

text:
Solve a reading... open tray problem Clean the disk with a slightly damp cloth. Do not use solvents. Remove stickers.  If this doesn't work, follow the instructions below.  Solve a game related problem Turn off the console, and remove any USB drives attached.  Check that the game is the correct region code. NTSC: North America and South America (United States, Canada, Mexico, Chile, and Brazil)
NTSC-J: Asia (Hong Kong SAR, Japan, Korea, Singapore, and Taiwan)
PAL: Europe, South Africa, India, Australia, and New Zealand Try another game.  If all of the above fails, your console will need service.  Solve a DVD related problem Check the DVD region. 1: United States, Canada, Bermuda, U.S. territories
2: Europe (except Russia, Ukraine and Belarus), Middle East, Egypt, Japan, South Africa, Swaziland, Lesotho, Greenland
3: Southeast Asia, South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong SAR, Macau
4: Mexico, Central and South America, Australia, New Zealand, Oceania
5: India, Afghanistan, Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, Africa, Central and South Asia, North Korea
6: People's Republic of China, Hong Kong
7: Reserved
8: Special international venues, such as airplanes and cruise ships Try another DVD.  If all of the above fails, your console will need service.  Solve a CD related  problem Check the CD format. The following CD formats are supported by Xbox: CD-DA, CD-ROM, CD-ROM XA, CD-R, CD-RW, CD-Extra. The following music files are supported: WMA, MP3, JPEG. Try another CD.  If all of the above fails, your console will need service.  Correct disc tray stuck open error Check the power button. If the Xbox is on, move on to the next step. If it is not on, check the power source and cables. Remove the disc from the tray, then press eject. If the tray closes, open the tray and insert the disc. Try to use the tray with a disc in it. Gently move the disc tray up and down, left and right. Then press eject. If it closes, try to use the tray with a disc in it. If all of the above fails, your console will need service.  Correct  disc tray stuck shut error Check the power button. If the Xbox is on, move on to the next step. If it is not on, check the power source and cables. Check for a plastic strip. This is used to keep the disc tray shut while the Xbox is shipped. If you find one, peel it off. Try to manually open the disk drive. You can find how to do this for your console online. If all of the above fails, your console will need service.
